      • FileSet

        public FileSet(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String destination)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Convenience constructor that creates a new, empty FileSet with the destination path specified.
        Parameters:
        destination - String representing the full path to the destination for the backup operation. This should be a folder path.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the path provided in destination is invalid or unreachable.
        java.lang.Exception

        public static FileSet read(java.lang.String fullPathToFile)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Factory method that reads a FileSet from the path specified and constructs a FileSet object from the contents of the file
        Parameters:
        fullPathToFile - The absolute path of where to read the FileSet from
        Returns:
        FileSet The FileSet that was just read in from disk.

        java.lang.Exception

      • save

        public static void save(java.lang.String fullPathToFile,
                        FileSet fileSet)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Saves a FileSet to a directory. The file will have the name contained in fileSet.name and will be stored in the path provided in the absolutePath parameter.
        Parameters:
        fullPathToFile - The absolute path indicating where to create and save the FileSet. This should be a FILE path and NOT a directory. The name of the saved FileSet will be the right-most element in the filePath parameter. If a file with this complete path already exists, it will be overwritten with the contents of the FileSet passed in via this parameter.
        fileSet - The FileSet object to save to disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Will throw an IOException if the destination cannot be written to or a write error occurs.
